result.execSummary:
The defendant Ronald F. Latour was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald F. Latour

records.addlTxt:
10:20 AM Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ronald F. Latour in court without counsel. Defendant advised of right to an attorney. Defendant waived right to attorney freely and voluntarily. There is an agreement. State in compliance with victim notification requirements. 

Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1: Disorderly Conduct as a Domestic. Defendant is advised of charges, maximum penalties, elements of the crime(s) and constitutional rights. Court accepts plea and finds the defendant guilty. 

Court orders: court costs and DNA sample and surcharges.
CK 44085 mailed to defendant; signature bond ordered, bail posted refunded.

Conditions:
No contact with B.A.M. or her residence.
Defendant allowed to retrieve belongings one time if accompanied by a law enforcement officer. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold.

11:32 AM case called. Prosecuting attorney Tiffany M. Winter in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Ronald F. Latour in court without counsel. Defendant waives reading of the complaint. 
Settlement Conference (by phone) with District Attorney's Office (715-839-4828) on 7-25-22 at 2:00 PM. 
Return to court: 8-16-22 at 9:30 AM.

Conditions:
No contact with B.A.M. or her residence.
Defendant allowed to retrieve belongings one time if accompanied by a law enforcement officer. 
Defendant to maintain absolute sobriety. 
Defendant not to consume/possess any alcohol or go into any taverns, bars, liquor stores/place where alcohol is primarily served/sold.
